div.p: Grace and peace through the Lord. As for how things stand with us in our League, I have informed you that the matter has been set for the middle of May.

Meanwhile, the Milanese are sending a delegation with great promises for the communities in our League; this is quite contrary to some. I think it will serve to make all the lords go idle, etc. Also, on the 24th of April, our bishop was summoned to Rome and is being accused there as a Lutheran bishop; therefore, he is not worthy to be a papal bishop, etc.

There is nothing new from Italy. Dr. Vergerius is doing quite well in Vespera, etc. When I handed over your Decade to the bishop, I offered to have it bound; he replied that he wanted to read it once, then return it to me so that I could have it bound at his expense. Farewell.
Comander and the other excellent men send you many greetings. Hastily, Chur, 26th of April, in the year 1550.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Bullinger, the most vigilant pastor of the most ample church of Zurich, his most esteemed lord and brother.
